items.title: With Sensors on Streets, France Takes Aim at ‘Noise From Hell’
items.abstract: The French authorities are installing “sound radars” in some cities to detect and photograph vehicles making excessive noise, which they say is a public health hazard.

items.title: The Sights and Smells of Sicily’s Second City
items.abstract: While it doesn’t attract the same kind of attention as Palermo, Catania seems to be getting ready for its moment in the spotlight.

items.title: New York Police Begin Using ShotSpotter System to Detect Gunshots
items.abstract: As part of a pilot program, sensors are being placed in precincts in the Bronx and in Brooklyn, a total area of 15 square miles, where there have been a high number of shootings.

items.title: Boeing Built Deadly Assumptions Into 737 Max, Blind to a Late Design Change
items.abstract: A system that doomed two flights was expected to engage only rarely and originally used two sensors. Critical decisions were based on those factors even when they no longer applied, employees said.
keywords: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

items.title: I’m an Engineer, and I’m Not Buying Into ‘Smart’ Cities
items.abstract: Sensor-equipped garbage cans sound cool, but someone still has to take out the trash.
